intro: Lycianthes peranomala, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and oval, green leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by orange to red berries that contain several seeds. Lycianthes peranomala is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in folk medicine.
